intro: Myriocephalus helichrysoides, commonly known as the golden star bush, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, and thrives in well-drained, sandy soils. Its compact growth habit and ornamental flowers make it a popular choice for coastal gardens. It is also valued for its drought tolerance and ability to attract pollinators.
